dialog: The only thing I ever knew was cotton.
Now, you know cotton is ready when the bud splits, and the boll is starshaped, like a big ol' star in the sky.
Or like your big ol' head.
Hold on, is that some cotton?
But I didn't mind,  'cause I got to spend all day working with my daddy.
Hattie, come on, I need your help in the shed.
Don't you lose your temper with that man.
Now, get on back to work.
Hey, you. Get some of the hands to help dig a hole for his pa.
I'm gonna have you in the house now.
I'm gonna teach you how to be a house nigger.
I don't even want to hear you breathe.
The room should feel empty when you're in it.
It was much nicer working in the house than in the field.
When I got older, I knew I had to go before he killed me, too.
Part of me was scared to leave.
It was the only world I ever knew.
My mama never spoke much after that.
I knew she'd miss me,  but I also knew she wanted me to leave that place.
And even though Miss Annabeth never said it,  I knew she'd miss me, too.
I don't think God meant for people to not have a family.
Outside the cotton fields was even worse than I thought it would be.
No one would give me a job nor food nor a place to sleep.
Any white man could kill any of us at any time and not be punished for it.
The law wasn't on our side.
I was hungry all the time.
You know what can happen to you, son?
I'm gonna have to lie to the boss man about that window.
The good Lord say we ain't supposed to lie.
Where's your ma and your pa?
My ma crazy in the head, and my pa got killed.
I'll make you some ham sandwiches and send you on your way.
The boss will be here in a minute.
You done broke our window, you done stole our food, and now you asking for a job?
Back in Macon, I'm a house nigger, a good one.
Don't you ever use that word, son.
Didn't your father ever teach you any better?
You got to look through their eyes.
See what it is they want.
See what it is they need.
Bring a smile to the eyes...
Don't forget to save me them chitlins.
Why you like chitlins so much?
The manager of Excelsior, in DC, he came by yesterday.
He offered me a job as a butler.
He must be paying you top dollar, huh, boss?
I was thinking about taking it, but I don't know.
I'm too old to be leaving North Carolina.
I told him to hire you.
I'm just now finding my way around this hotel.
Ain't ready for all them highfalutin white people, all their fancy words.
ours, and the ones that we got to show the white folks.
Now, to get up in the world, you have to make them feel nonthreatened.
Use that, them fancy words that I've taught you.
White folks up north, they like some uppity coloreds.
I took that job up in Washington, DC.
It was the most beautiful hotel I'd ever seen.
I hope it wasn't too presumptuous of me to have prepared a few spirits after your long journey here from Buffalo.
The best decision that court ever made was to slow this whole mess down.
Nigger boys in school with white girls.
Who ever heard of such a thing?
Next thing you know, they'd be fornicating.
We could start another Civil War.
Cecil, what do you think about niggers going to school with white children?
To be honest with you, Mr. Jenkins, I tend to not be too concerned with American or European politics.
Earl Warren should be shot and hanged.
That dumb sonofabitch judge is trying to integrate our schools.
I think Judge Warren is going to find that quite challenging.
Never in my life did I dream I'd work in a place as fancy as this.
I never dreamed my life could be so good.
Gloria and I met working at the Excelsior.
She was a maid at the hotel,  but now her only job was raising our two boys.
I made sure that they never laid eyes on a cotton field.
I miss you at night, honey.
Didn't you say you got to pee?
Wash your hands when you come out of that bathroom, boy.
That woman whose son got killed, she's around doing speeches now.
I remember that story just like it was yesterday, even though it was three years ago.
It was a disdamngrace what they did to that boy.
Just for looking at a white woman.
Beat him up, threw his body in the river, killed him.
He wasn't no older than Louis.
At least we got it a little better in DC, huh?
Louis said we should stop taking the white man's shit.
Uh, yeah. Hold on, Mr. Kidgan.
When the white man call, I always assume the worst.
I would have put money on it that I was getting laid off or something that day.
It's a pleasure to meet you.
We have no tolerance for politics at the White House.
You served R.D. Warner at the Excelsior Hotel.
He oversees operations for the entire White House.
Mr. Warner and myself make note of potential staff around town.
Butler positions rarely open, as most stay on for 30 years or more.
I know I was quite surprised when I got the call.
It was a surprise for me, as well.
As the White House maÃ®tre d', I normally hire the butler.
Forgive me for saying this, Mr. Fallows.
I certainly wouldn't want to be hired under circumstances that would make you feel uncomfortable.
You need butlers that you've handpicked, men to your liking that will fulfill your vision of a proper White House staff.
These decanters are replicas of metal flasks that were found on the battlefield in Jarnac.
The Italians, they know their wines, and the Irish, they certainly know how to make a great whiskey.
But I believe the French have a distinct advantage when it comes to Cognac.
Yeah, you'll make a good house nigger.
Would you care for a demitasse?
Sometimes it just be me and Faye up in here.
Me, Faye and a little scotch.
You know how to throw a bash, girl.
What did you do to this potato salad?
I'll tell you what I did.
I put some dill in it, because I read in Woman's Day, where pickles drown out the flavor and dill bring up the flavor.
That's what you tasting right now.
Girl, you must be so proud of Cecil.
You know he got that job hisself.
The White House called him,  he didn't call the White House.
Not like this one right here.
No, you don't. I told you, I went down to the numbers spot, played my little numbers, got me some barbecue, and then I went down...
I didn't even get nothing to drink!
I am so... I'm so sick of these numbers spot stories, Howard.
How you expect me to believe you was down at the numbers spot?
Whether you believe it or not don't mean it ain't true.
You want to do this right now?
Come on, come on, come on.
You don't believe it, you don't have to believe it, but...
You really want to do this right now?
You need to pick on somebody your own size.
We are here to celebrate, so y'all could be nice just one time.
Come on, get over here, let's celebrate!
That's why I was out, trying to make you happy.
Y'all need to get a room.
He drives me crazy. He just... Ugh!
You want to come to the room with us?
They upstairs in the back room.
I need to see your face now!
Honey, when you gonna take me to the White House?
You want to go to the White House, baby?
You know I want to go to the White House.
The White House, now that's a big step up.
Girl, you up in that house now!
I want to hear all the stories.
I don't know how many stories you gonna hear, 'cause they done swore him to some kind of secret code,  and he can't tell me nothing.
No. Girl, you give it to him right.
Who you been giving it to?
Well, if you was at home, I could be giving it to you.
I don't know what you talking about.
Boys, y'all better bring y'all little narrow butts down here!
Boys, stop running through this house.
Nah. Tell them... Tell them what you gonna be when you grow up.
I want to work at the White House just like Mr. Gaines.
Louis! What you gonna be when you grow up?
You gonna work at the White House like your daddy?
I knew exactly what I wanted to be when I was 13.
We have six butlers, four carpenters, two painters,  seven electricians, three dishwashers, three doormen,  a full kitchen staff, including pastry chef and three fulltime calligraphers.
Two painters, seven electricians, nine engineers...
Uh, Mr. Warner, wanted to thank you for the opportunity to work in the White House...
I'll be working with you here.
Mr. Gaines, please don't do that.
Now, when lifting a plate, never scrape the bottom.
Never listen or react to conversation.
Then she says, "Stick..." "OK." Then she starts screaming and yells, "Stick your whole hand in!" So I put my whole hand in.
Then she yells out, "Put both hands in!" "OK!" Then she screams, "Now clap!" I say, "I can't." She looks up, smiles and says, "See, I told you my..." That ain't funny.
Don't worry about Big Mo behind you.
That brother will steal your wallet before you even knew it.
This brother in the mirror over here, his name's James Holloway.
Why don't you shake the man's hand first before you start asking difficult questions like that?
I just want to know where the man's coming from.
Look like the jury's still out on that one, right?
Fancy Freddie give you the tour yet?
Is the Dodgers still... still losing?
I might be able to answer that question if Carter over here stop running his nasty mouth.
Cut the shit and let's get to work.
Just go on and get to it.
You hear nothing, you see nothing.
Send federal troops to Little Rock?
If it comes to it, yes.
I can't see any situation where I'd send federal troops to the South.
Ever. Could cause another Civil War.
Sir, if the federal government doesn't enforce Brown, then who will?
The South must comply with the law.
It's just gonna take some time to adjust, that's all.
I understand, Mr. President, but if Faubus continues to block the Negro children, then what do we do?
With a little persuading, he'll back down.
We just want to move slowly.
I dated a girl once. Every time I hit her, she shit herself.
You know, Marcella said the very same thing last night just before I put her to sleep.
Got the popcorn all over the sofa.
Louis, I told you about letting these kids watch that show.
All you got to do is smile pretty,  and a man will forget everything he ever learned.
Miss Gloria tried staying up, but she went to sleep.
Elroy, ain't nobody asked you nothing.
Take your butt home before your mama come up in here and whup the both of us.
Don't go stomping up the stairs, wake your mama up.
Is that that Mamie Till stuff?
I want to go to this.
Ain't no good can come of that.
Dad, you heard what Mama said?
That mess right there happened down South.
I got out of there so we could have us a better life.
Right now, I'm working for the white man, make things better for us.
And not just any white man, either.
I have your chicken soup, Mr. President.
Just set it on the table, Cecil.
Did you ever complete school, Cecil?
I didn't go to school, Mr. President.
I grew up on a cotton farm.
I grew up on a farm.
Yes, sir, I have two sons.
Do they go to an allcolored school?
State Guard just blocked all the colored kids again.
Faubus promised me the guards would escort the kids in.
Governor of Arkansas lied, Mr. President.
Why is he forcing me to do this?
Our next move needs to be bold and swift.
I have today issued an executive order directing the use of troops under federal authority to aid in the execution of federal law at Little Rock, Arkansas.
When the president sent those troops down to Little Rock,  it was the first time I ever seen a white man stick his neck out for us.
I told Louis that the president was gonna make things better for us.
I'm gonna make some potato salad.
Now he could see that I knew what I was talking about.
Did you see one white kid in my school?
Why couldn't Louis see that the president made things better for us?
Boy, I told you we was gonna be late!
Wait, a sec. Wait, wait, wait.
Tennessee is a long ways away, Pop.
Fisk is a really good school, Dad.
You can change your mind and go to Howard.
I cannot believe you are still talking about Howard University.
I know, I know. It's just...
It's just so far away, that's all.
Give me a cigarette, and don't tell me you don't smoke.
You know you want to cry, punk.
I can't protect him down South.
The South ain't what it was when you was there.
Ma, Louis is leaving me his filthy magazines.
He's the one with the magazines.
If you need anything, you call me.
Remind me again why we're doing this, please.
That look like a mugging to me,  that's what that looks like.
This is the art of French baking.
"Art of French baking." This is absolutely nothing.
You want me to play with it?
It'd be good if it had a little...
That's how you play. You jiggle it.
That looks like a tasty treat.
I don't want to say anything negative about that Kennedy boy.
I'm sure he's a real nice fellow.
But do you really want that spoiled rich sonofabitch fuck to be your next president?
We'll cheer for you, Mr. Vice President.
Let me ask you something, in all candor, as members of the Negro community, what are your biggest concerns?
The colored help gets paid almost  Is that right?
And it's very difficult for the colored staff to be promoted.
I'll tell you what. When I'm president, I'm gonna look into getting you boys the raises and the promotions you deserve.
That... that would be swell, sir.
You got my word on that.
Now, you tell your people to vote for me, and that's exactly what's gonna happen.
What do you mean, you don't want to date nobody?
After all these guys that come after you?
I'm talking about you and Isaac.
Now, come on, tell me what happened.
See, I can't even have a normal conversation with you, because...
That's what we call the Lawson workshop, the love school.
Is that what you're looking for?
That's why I came to Fisk.
You a country boy, ain't you?
You were gonna need help finding this place anyway.
...nor can you sustain it over a month.
This requires time, commitment, dedication, discipline and focus.
And we are measuring our accomplishments in waves, right?
This is not a flybynight affair.
This doesn't happen over a week.
This requires a fierce discipline, which is what we've been discussing.
How do you measure these things?
We go back, and we look at somebody like Gandhi.
Together, we are gonna study and examine Gandhi's techniques.
What has been so effective in South Africa, so effective in India, for his own people and others, and we're gonna employ it right here, in Nashville.
So we're gonna form an army.
Now, I am of the... yes.
If our only weapon is love, and then their weapons are weapons,  I mean, isn't that dangerous?
If anybody's uncomfortable with that, you know where the door is.
I understand that sounds provocative, but it's true.
Gandhi has demonstrated for us that the brown man, in his native land, or anywhere that he's being oppressed...
...can pull himself out of segregation with patience, with persistence, with intelligence and thought, with discipline...
...and a bit of a sense of humor.
You know y'all can't sit here.
We would like to be served, please.
This is unprecedented, what we're talking about,  but it needs a patience that none of us have ever seen.
You can order food in the colored section, but I'm not gonna be serving you here.
We have a leader with every group.
We have lookouts with pocket change and the local phone numbers for ambulances ready,  and when one wave comes off that lunch counter, what follows?
A whole 'nother wave of Negro students sitting at that lunch counter, blowing their mind.
We would like to be served, please.
Jim, I need your help over here.
Now, y'all know you're not supposed to sit there.
So do whatever it takes to break their spirits.
I need to hear "nigger" coming out of your mouth.
I need to hear "coon."  I don't feel comfortable saying that.
You came here to get yourself prepared and to get her prepared.
So let me hear it now.
Say the words like you mean it.
You need to be sitting in the colored seating.
This is not for you, you cannot be served here.
You need to do as you're told and sit in your place.
You know that's where the colored people sit.
You see these people over here?
They're in their section over here.
If you want us to shop in this establishment, make them go.
This says "whites only." Get up, nigger. Get up!
Does it say "coons?"  "Whites only." You don't belong here with them.
You don't belong here at all.
I didn't know niggers could read.
What do you think you're doing here?
Get up! Get up, you nigger!
Look at me! Look at me!
That up there or is that here?
You don't have to tell me,  but you have to decide.
Go back to where you came from!
...the niggers are better off in their own schools than they are in the white schools.
I like the way that tastes.
They got no business out here.
...better off in their own schools than they are in the white schools.
You're all sentenced to 30 days  in the county jail.
Bailiff, get these niggers out of here.
Something special is going on down here, Dad.
What's so special about another colored man in jail?
What you doing with my hard earned money, Pop?
I'm trying to change the way Negroes...
That judge just sentenced you to 30 days in the county workhouse.
If I can't sit at any lunch counter I want, then I might as well be dead.
We're trying to change the nation's consciousness toward the American Negro.
Them postcards you've been sending me?
Who do you think you're talking to?
I brought you into this world, I can take you out of it.
Y'all been able to talk to him?
Said he's joined something called the "Freedom Riders," whatever the hell that's supposed to mean.
I been fixing to trying to see him.
Every time I do, Cecil get all riled up.
So I don't know when that's gonna happen.
"Fixing to trying." See, that's the problem.
You got to stop trying, and you just got to do it.
He take you to the White House yet?
No. Cecil say we're going soon.
"Cecil say, Cecil say." Four years. That's what makes you a little bit gullible, darling.
I don't understand why he can't  get the president to do something.
President got more to do than be thinking about Louis' foolishness.
You know, why don't you just shut up?
Who told you you could tell me to shut up?
Well, I personally think Louis is gonna get every one of us killed.
I meant it in a good way.
I received also a wire from President Eisenhower, which says...
The president lives at the White House until the moment the next one is sworn in.
So the staff has exactly two hours during the inauguration ceremony, to move the old president out and move the new one in.
They say this new white boy's smooth.
I just need to get my butt home to Gloria.
I am thrilled to be working with all of you over the next four years.
Well, you see who wears the pants around here.
I'm not gonna remember any of your names, but I'm gonna try.
Jessie. It's a good thing you're here 'cause I'm gonna forget.
Pleasure to meet you, Mr. President.
I got it. She's all right.
Pleasure to meet you, Miss Caroline.
What's that on your breath, Gloria? Stop, OK. Stop.
I can smell it from here.
It said "Addison's disease." Stop. Stop it, will you stop?
Did you take Charlie to the dentist today?
Somebody at the White House got Addison's disease?
No, I did not take Charlie to the dentist today.
And what you asking me about it for?
Now you gonna act like you gonna take Charlie to the dentist?
I don't know how you gonna take him.
His teeth fall out, waiting on you to take him.
How many pairs of shoes does she have?
I said, how many pairs of shoes does Mrs. Jackie Kennedy have?
How the hell do I know?
You're in that ol' White House day and night.
Coming in, trying to tell me what to do.
You ought to be worried about your house.
Our boy's in jail, and you can't come home.
You... You don't see I'm here, trying to talk to you?
I bet you wish I spoke French, just like Jackie.
You like the way she talk?
Cecil, you hear me talking to you.
Bobby told the president they shouldn't be worried about the Negro sitins.
Polls show the US does not support civil rights.
Told you that white boy was smooth.
A little too smooth for my money.
Hey, Cecil, how's your boy doing?
Out of jail, says he's back in school, but I think he's doing that freedom riding thing.
How's Gloria doing with that drinking?
They say that cat that's playing is a big deal.
You think Mrs. Kennedy is gonna have, uh...
some backwoods country fiddle band playing out there for her?
Why don't you start a band?
Maybe you can go out there, too.
You know what, in fact, let's all start a band.
I play a mean... skin flute.
He refuses to play in any country that recognizes Franco's regime.
You just want me to put my head on your shoulder.
I'm not putting my head on your shoulder.
Ever been on a freedom bus before?
How's your boyfriend feel about that?
Yeah. I mean, this must upset him, right?
You being on this bus down here.
How do you not have a boyfriend?
Hey, can I have some of those?
It's a cross. It's a cross.
"In an old house in Paris that was covered with vines...
...lived 12 little girls in two straight lines.
The smallest one was Madeline."  Like Caroline.
"She was not afraid of mice." Why do people ride in the freedom bus?
Uncle Bobby told my daddy that the freedom bus exploded today.
I can't tell you if I walked off the bus or if I crawled off or if someone pulled me off.
I didn't know if my boy was dead or alive.
When I got off the bus, a man came up to me,  and I'm coughing and strangling,  and he said, "Boy, you all right?" And I nodded my head, and the next thing I knew,  I was on the ground.
He had hit me with a baseball bat.
I thought you was in Alabama.
We spent two weeks in jail there, now we're in Mississippi.
I want you to listen to me, Louis.
I want you to come home.
I know we ain't seen eye to eye,  but your mama, she wants you home.
When I get out, I'm gonna take another ride.
It is my right to ride that bus.
I will exercise my rights as an American citizen.
You know what they're gonna do to you?
They're gonna lynch you and then they're gonna throw your little ass in the river.
Ma, then they're just gonna have to kill me.
...Negro and white in Birmingham have been building up to scenes with clashes, like this.
The situation was perilously close to an explosion.
Arrests were made in mass lots.
Everyone charged with the same offense...
City police were carrying out their pledge to fill their jails to capacity if necessary.
They are acting according to the wishes...
I don't know what country I'm looking at.
...tone of the city for many years.
Residents here have taken to the streets in Birmingham, Alabama, to bring attention to their efforts against the segregation of black Americans.
This is following earlier boycotts in Birmingham to pressure...
Hey, Louis, man, that little nigga might be onto something.
Stop calling him a nigga, 'cause he ain't no nigga.
What's wrong with me is this.
This is what's wrong with me.
This is wrong. This is wrong.
I can't do this to Cecil.
We ain't doing it to Cecil.
I want you out of my house.
Why do you think God brought us next to each other each day?
God ain't got nothing to do with this.
He put you right next door to me.
You always talking about how lonely you are without Cecil being at the White House, and you need a man that can appreciate the love and the woman that you are, like I do.
I want your numberrunning ass up out of my house, off of my sofa right now.
Let me make a demonstration for you.
Don't come here with this bullshit crazy talk.
This is you, right? You got your direction that you move in.
What you doing with my hangers?
This is you, and this is me.
Now, we seem like we don't fit at all.
We just crash into each other.
But then when you align things properly, like God putting you next door to me, everything kind of works out.
And even if you slow down, I got you.
You need to get your yellow ass up out of my house.
What I need is my husband.
And not to be laying up here in the gutter with you.
On average, how many pills do you think I take a day, Cecil?
I know your son is a Freedom Ryder.
He's in prison right now in Birmingham with Martin Luther King.
I'm guessing he's pretty beat up, but based on his record, he must be used to it.
Cecil, he's been arrested 16 times over the past two years.
You know, I never understood what you all really went through...
My brother says these kids have...
The fires of discord are burning in every city North and South,  where legal remedies are not at hand.
Redress is sought in the streets,  in demonstrations, parades and protests.
I am therefore asking the Congress to enact legislation giving all Americans the right to be served in facilities which are open to the public.
Hotels, restaurants, theaters,  retail stores and similar establishments.
This seems to me to be an elementary right.
Its denial is an arbitrary indignity that no American in 1963 should have to endure, but many do.
A great change is at hand.
And our task, our obligation, is to make that revolution,  that change, peaceful and constructive for all.
Those who do nothing are inviting shame as well as violence...
President Kennedy was shot as he drove from Dallas airport to downtown Dallas...
Governor Connally of Texas in the car with him was also shot.
It is reported that three bullets rang out.
"He's dead." Whether he referred to President Kennedy or not is not yet known.
The president, cradled in the arms of his wife, Mrs. Kennedy,  was carried to an ambulance and the car rushed to Parkland Hospital outside Dallas...
Mrs. Kennedy refused to change her clothes,  so that everybody could see what they did to her husband.
The last time I saw that much blood was the day my daddy was killed.
Please tell me how I could help you.
Here. Want you to take this box and put it in the basement.
Make sure you label it "trophies."  This is Louis' stuff, Ma.
You know he gonna be pissed.
I don't care nothing about Louis being pissed.
He ain't been here in three years.
And don't put that next to my jarred okra either.
Ain't nobody trying to smell that stankin' okra.
And when you come back, I want you to get me some fish food.
I'm really sorry about the president.
But you and that White House can kiss my ass.
I don't care what goes on in that house.
I care about what goes on in this house.
I knew that Gloria had been unhappy for some time now.
I knew that's probably why she drank.
She wanted me to get along better with Louis.
I could cut back them long hours at the White House.
How many pairs of shoes she got?
A hundred twentyfive pairs of shoes?
Put them in a line from the blacks all the way to the whites.
And I'll tell you what. Next time there's a light on in an empty room, I will fire every sorry son of a bitch in this house. I mean it, Cecil!
Go back to Texas and run the country from a dirt shack if I have to.
Who do you think pays the goddamned bills around here?
I don't, but you know what I mean.
Lady Bird and I want you to have this.
You see me, babe? Put it on.
Now that's what I'm talking about.
Get it, girl! Shake it out! Get it!
Back there stinking up my bathroom.
He can still do the splits, I'll tell you.
James told me that Dr. King told the president that we would be going to the streets down South for our right to vote.
Didn't you tell me that Dr. King told the president that we was going down South for our right to vote?
That Dr. King ain't no joke, with his little militant ass.
Well, you know them three kids got killed down there, trying to get colored folks registered to vote.
That's why I didn't want Louis to go down there.
That's what I was trying to tell you.
You shouldn't have sent him down there.
He is down there now, and there ain't nothing we can do about it.
The only reason the president sent the FBI is 'cause two of them were white.
It was in one of them colored newspapers from Baltimore. That all right with you?
Honey, you think the president ought to do something  about the Voting Rights bill?
President Johnson just passed the greatest piece of civil rights legislation since Lincoln freed the slaves.
It's gonna be very difficult to pass another bill anytime soon.
You see how my wife quizzes me?
Only, you got to know how much to say, when you cross the line.
You deal with your woman, I'll deal with mine.
At least you tell your wife what's going on over there.
Can't be a king in your own castle.
You hit the strip joint, that's what I say.
Hey, uh, Glo. Did you hear about your neighbor, Howard?
Guy down on 8th Street, caught him in bed with his wife.
That's it. That's all of it.
I don't know, maybe he got what he deserved.
You sorry sap asses got to realize the Negro ain't gonna take it no more.
This entire country is a tinderbox.
Goddamn tinderbox of nigger rage just waiting to explode!
Now, I want you all to get on the phone, call the NAACP, CORE and whoever else will listen to your sorry asses and help me keep them Negroes off the street.
Buck, I smell your ass from here!
What the hell are you waiting for?!
Cecil, get me some of that goddamned prune juice.
I'm not sure what to make of Malcolm X.
I know what to make of him.
Got a better plan in place than Dr. King.
